intro: Ophiorrhiza acuminatissima, commonly known as the slender sandalwood or narrow-leaved sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Ophiorrhiza acuminatissima is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in coastal and disturbed areas.
